org.apache.flex.compiler.fxg.flex

Class FlexRichTextNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.AbstractFXGNode
      • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.GraphicContentNode
        • org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.RichTextNode
          • org.apache.flex.compiler.fxg.flex.FlexRichTextNode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFXGNode, IMaskableNode, IPreserveWhiteSpaceNode, ITextNode

    public class FlexRichTextNode
extends RichTextNode
    A Flex specific override for RichTextNode used to capture the attributes specified on a <RichText> node in FXG 2.0.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GraphicContext createGraphicContext()
      Since RichText is converted to a sprite based ActionScript class and rendered using Flex's RichText API, we do not report attributes on the graphic context that are going to be set as properties in ActionScript (as otherwise you would end up with duplicate transformations).
      void setDocumentNode(IFXGNode root)
      If the document root is a FlexGraphicNode, it records that the document makes use of TextGraphic and thus will need to generate symbol classes to programmatically draw the text (as there is no equivalent to TextGraphic in SWF).

      • Methods inherited from class org.apache.flex.compiler.internal.fxg.dom.RichTextNode

    • Method Detail

      • setDocumentNode

        public void setDocumentNode(IFXGNode root)
        If the document root is a FlexGraphicNode, it records that the document makes use of TextGraphic and thus will need to generate symbol classes to programmatically draw the text (as there is no equivalent to TextGraphic in SWF).
        Specified by:
        setDocumentNode in interface IFXGNode
        Overrides:
        setDocumentNode in class AbstractFXGNode
        Parameters:
        root - - the root node of the FXG document.

      • createGraphicContext

        public GraphicContext createGraphicContext()
        Since RichText is converted to a sprite based ActionScript class and rendered using Flex's RichText API, we do not report attributes on the graphic context that are going to be set as properties in ActionScript (as otherwise you would end up with duplicate transformations).

        The ignored graphic context attributes include: 

         x="..."
 y="..."
 scaleX="..."
 scaleY="..."
 rotation="..."
 blendMode="..."
 alpha="..."

        Overrides:
        createGraphicContext in class GraphicContentNode
